tit.e: Kanjo-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Yuraku, Takatori Town, Nara Prefecture)
Kanjo-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Yuraku, Takatori Town, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: カンジョ古墳（かんじょこふん、乾城古墳、与楽カンジョ古墳 とも）は、奈良県高取町与楽に存在する古墳。
sen.e: Kanjo Tumulus (also referred to as Yoraku Kanjo Tumulus) is a tumulus located in Yoraku, Takatori-cho, Nara Prefecture.
Kanjo Tumulus (also referred to as Yoraku Kanjo-kofun Tumulus) is a tumulus located in Yoraku, Takatori Town, Nara Prefecture.
Kanjo Tumulus (also referred to as Yoraku Kanjo-kofun Tumulus) is a tumulus located in Yoraku, Takatori Town, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良県一の高さの石室を持つことで知られる。
sen.e: It is known to have the tallest stone chamber in Nara Prefecture.
It is known to have the tallest stone chamber in Nara Prefecture.
It is known to have the tallest stone chamber in Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 墳丘の北側と西側が掘削されているため、原形や規模が不明だった。
sen.e: The original shape and size of the tumulus was unknown because the northern part as well as the western part of the tumulus had been excavated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The original shape and size of the tumulus was unknown because the northern part as well as the western part of the tumulus had been excavated.
The original shape and size of the tumulus was unknown because the northern part as well as the western part of the tumulus had been excavated.

sen.j: だが、調査の結果、一辺約36メートル前後の方墳と判明している。
sen.e: As a result of a research, the tumulus turned out to be a square tumulus of 36 meters on a side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result of a research, the tumulus turned out to be a square tumulus of 36 meters on a side.
As a result of a research, the tumulus turned out to be a square tumulus of 36 meters on a side.

sen.j: 埋葬施設として、両袖式の横穴式石室をもち、石室の天井が極めて高いことが、この古墳の特徴である。
sen.e: This tumulus is characteristic in having a both-sleeve type horizontal stone chamber with a extremely high ceiling for the burial space.

This tumulus is characteristic in having a horizontal stone chamber with ryosode-style (a stone chamber with the passage connected the center of the burial chamber wall) and with an extremely high ceiling for the burial space.

This tumulus is characteristic in having a horizontal stone chamber with ryosode-style (a stone chamber with the passage connected the center of the burial chamber wall) and with an extremely high ceiling for the burial space.

sen.j: 床面に土砂が流入していたため、石室の正確な天井高が不明であった。
sen.e: The stone chamber floor was covered with sands so the exact height to the ceiling was unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The stone chamber floor was covered with sand flowed so the exact height to the ceiling was unknown.
The stone chamber floor was covered with sand flowed so the exact height to the ceiling was unknown.

sen.j: だが、平成20年の再調査により、石室の高さ5.27メートルであることが判明した（平成20年8月5日高取町教育委員会発表）。
sen.e: However, the research conducted again in 2008 and the stone chamber proved to be 5.27 meters high (reported by Takatori-cho Board of Education on August 5, 2008)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the research conducted again in 2008 and the stone chamber proved to be 5.27 meters high (reported by Takatori Town Board of Education on August 5, 2008)
However, the research conducted again in 2008 and the stone chamber proved to be 5.27 meters high (reported by Takatori Town Board of Education on August 5, 2008)

sen.j: 石室の高さは、石舞台古墳（高さ4.8メートル）を上回り、奈良県内一と見られる。
sen.e: The stone chamber is taller than that of Ishibutai Tumulus (4.8 meters high,) and considered the tallest in Nara Prefecture.
The stone chamber is taller than that of Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus (4.8 meters high), and considered the tallest in Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: The stone chamber is taller than that of Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus (4.8 meters high), and considered the tallest in Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: また、石室の幅は3.7メートル、長さ6メートルと判明した。
sen.e: The stone chamber turned out to be3.7 meters wide and 6 meters long.
The stone chamber turned out to be 3.7 meters wide and 6 meters long.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。
sen.e: The stone chamber turned out to be 3.7 meters wide and 6 meters long.

sen.j: この調査により、石室の床面から、渡来人系の古墳で多く見られるミニチュア炊飯具の一部をはじめ、銀製指輪が出土した。
sen.e: A part of a miniature rice cooker which is often found in immigrants' tumuli as well as a silver ring were excavated from the stone chamber floor in this research.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A parts of a miniature rice cooker which is often found in immigrants' tumuli as well as a silver ring were excavated from the stone chamber floor in this research.
A parts of a miniature rice cooker which is often found in immigrants' tumuli as well as a silver ring were excavated from the stone chamber floor in this research.

sen.j: また、玄室の中央部からは棺台の一部と推定される高さ15センチメートルの盛り上がりや、木棺に使用される鉄釘が出土した。
sen.e: Also, 15 centimeters mound (estimated to be a part of a bier) along with iron nails for a wooden casket were excavated from the center of the burial chamber
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, 15 centimeters mound, estimated to be a part of a bier, along with iron nails for a wooden casket were excavated from the center of the burial chamber
Also, 15 centimeters mound, estimated to be a part of a bier, along with iron nails for a wooden casket were excavated from the center of the burial chamber

sen.j: 石室や出土品の特徴から、6世紀末から7世紀前半頃の渡来系の有力氏族（東漢氏）の首長の墓とみられている。
sen.e: From the characteristics of the stone chamber and the excavated artifacts, the tumulus is estimated to be a tomb of a local leader who was a member of a powerful immigrant clan (the Yamatonoaya clan) between the end of 6th century and the early 7th century.

From the characteristics of the stone chamber and the excavated artifacts, the tumulus is estimated to be a tomb of a local leader who was a member of a powerful immigrant clan (the Yamatonoaya clan) between the end of sixth century and the early seventh century.

From the characteristics of the stone chamber and the excavated artifacts, the tumulus is estimated to be a tomb of a local leader who was a member of a powerful immigrant clan (the Yamatonoaya clan) between the end of sixth century and the early seventh century.

sen.j: 1976年3月30日に奈良県の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: It was designated as a historic site by Nara Prefecture on March 30, 1976.
It was designated as a historic site by Nara Prefecture on March 30, 1976.
It was designated as a historic site by Nara Prefecture on March 30, 1976.

sen.j: 石室内に立ち入ることはできないが、鉄扉越しに石室内を観察することができる。
sen.e: The stone chamber is off-limits, but you can observe it from outside of the fence.
The stone chamber is off-limits, but you can observe it from outside of the iron door.
The stone chamber is off-limits, but you can observe it from outside of the iron door.
